name: Pizza
description: a dish of Italian origin consisting of a usually round, flat base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes, cheese and often various other ingredients

name: Burgers
description: a sandwich consisting of a patty, typically beef, placed inside a sliced bun or bread roll and often served with fillings

name: Steak
description: a meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, potentially including bone, and normally grilled but can also be pan-fried

name: Chicken Wings
description: breaded or unbreaded chicken wings that are generally deep-fried and then coated or dipped in a sauce

name: Chicken Tenders
description: chicken meat prepared by coating with a breading mixture and deep frying

name: Baked Potato
description: known in some parts of the United Kingdom as a jacket potato, is a whole potato baked in the oven and served with fillings, toppings, or condiments such as butter, cheese, and sour cream

name: Baby Back Ribs
description: pork ribs taken from the top of the rib cage prepared by smoking, grilling, or baking - usually with a sauce, often barbecue

name: Kebabs
description: a type of cooked meat dish that originates from cuisines of the Middle East consisting of cut up or ground meat, often skewered and cooked over a fire

name: Sushi
description: a Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice, usually with some sugar and salt, accompanied by a variety of ingredients such as seafood, often raw, and vegetables

name: Pho
description: a Vietnamese soup dish consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs and meat

name: Ramen
description: a Japanese noodle dish consisting of Chinese-style alkaline wheat noodles servied in a meat-based broth often flavored with soy sauce or miso with toppings such as sliced pork, nori (dried seaweed), menma and scallions

name: Pad Thai
description: a stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as a street food in Thailand

name: Tikka Masala
description: a dish either with a meat or meat substitute in spiced gravy that is usually creamy and orange-colored

name: Biryani
description: a mixed rice dish made with Indian spices, rice and usually some type of meat or with eggs and potatoes

name: Quesadillas
description: a Mexican dish consisting of a tortilla that is filled primarily with cheese and sometimes meats, spices and other fillings cooked on a griddle or stove

name: Lo Mein
description: a Chinese dish with egg noodles often containing vegetables and some type of meat or seafood

name: Chicken & Waffles
description: American dish combining chicken with waffles, deriving from culinary traditions including soul food and Pennsylvania Dutch cuisine

name: Omelette
description: dish made from beaten eggs, fried with butter or oil in a frying pan and often filled with vegetables, meats and cheeses

name: Bacon & Eggs
description: cooked breafkast meal consisting of eggs and bacon slices - served as a 'full breakfast' in the United Kingdom with black pudding and baked beans

name: Avocado Toast
description: a type of open sandwich consisting of toast with mashed avocado and usually salt, black pepper and sometimes citrus juice

name: Chicken Salad
description: mixed salad consisting of chopped chicken meat, vegetables, and a binder like mayonaisse or salad dressing

name: Spaghetti
description: a staple food of traditional Italian cuisine made of long, thin, solid, cylindrical pasta

name: Lasagna
description: stacked layers of lasagne alternating with fillings such as ground meats and tomato sauce, vegetables, and cheeses

name: Vegetable Lasagna
description: stacked layers of lasagne with only layers of vegetables and cheeses

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
description: a dish prepared using edible mushrooms with a variety of feelings, usually served as an hors d'oeuvre

name: Risotto
description: a northern Italian rice dish cooked with broth until it reaches a creamy consistency

name: Ceviche
description: a South American seafood dish originally from what is the modern day country of Peru, typically made from fresh raw fish cured in fresh citrus juices, most commonly lemon or lime - served cold

name: Lobster
description: evidence of human lobster consumption dates back 100,00 years and is often eaten with melted butter and lemon juice

name: Crab
description: crab meat is prized around the world for its soft, delicate and sweet taste while also being low in fat

name: Baked Salmon
description: a popular food fish, classified as an oil fish, that is rich in protein with a generally orange to red flesh

name: Baked Cod
description: a popular food fish with a mild flavor and dense, flaky white flesh

name: Sashimi
description: a Japanese delicacy consisting of fresh raw fish or meat sliced into thin pieces and often eaten with soy sauce

name: Sweet & Sour Chicken
description: a method of cooking chicken using both sweet and sour sauces stretch back as far as the Tang Dynasty festivals written in the year 708

name: Orange Chicken
description: an American Chinese dish consisting of chopped, battered and fried chicken pieces coated in a sweet orange-flavored chili sauce

name: General Tso's Chicken
description: a sweet and spicy deep-fried chicken dish served in North American Chinese restaurants

name: Mangú
description: the national breakfast of the Dominican Republic - consists of plantains, red onions, queso frito, fried eggs and fried Dominican salami

name: Pastelón
description: a Dominican and Puerto Rican casserole consisting of plantains, sofrito and minced beef

name: Tostones
description: double-fried plantain slices commonly found in Caribbean and Latin American cuisine

name: Mofongo
description: a traditionally Puerto Rican dish with plantains as its main ingredient cut into pieces and typically fried then mashed with salt, garlic, broth and olive oil in a wooden pilon

name: Empanadas
description: type of baked or fried turnover consisting of pastry and filling(name comes from the Spanish empanar which means to coat with bread)

name: Pancakes
description: a flat cake, often thin and round, prepared from a starch-based batter that may contain eggs, milk and butter and cooked on a hot surface such as a griddle or frying pan, often frying with oil or butter

name: Breakfast Sandwich
description: sandwich filled with foods associated with breakfast

name: Chicken Sandwich
description: sandwich typically consisting of boneless, skinless chicken breast or thigh served between slices of bread, on a bun, or on a roll

name: Samosas
description: fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, including ingredients such as spiced potatoes, onions, and peas

name: Curry
description: a dish with a saunce seasoned with spices, mainly associated with South Asian cuisine

name: Hot Dogs
description: grilled or steamed sausage served in the slit of a partially sliced bun

name: BBQ Chicken
description: entire chickens or chicken parts that are barbecued, grilled, or smoked

name: Pulled Pork
description: shredded barbecue pork shoulder

name: Mac 'n Cheese
description: dish of cooked macaroni pasta and a cheese sauce, most commonly cheddar

name: Pot Roast
description: a beef dish made by slow-cooking a usually tough cut of beef in moist heat
